Description: Strip of ivory inlay: decorated with an incised spiral pattern. The hollows in the carving were originally filled with a dark pigment, some of which remains. Near one end there is a hole, and traces of a similar hole are visible at the other end, which has been broken off. The fragment is in good condition, although it has been restored from two smaller pieces.
Curator's comments: For pieces with the same pattern, see W. M. F. Petrie, 'Royal Tombs of the Earliest Dynasties' II, pls. XXXIX, 37; XL, 45-7; XLI, 32; XLII, 71; XLIII, 40. Bibliography: W. M. F. Petrie, 'Royal Tombs of the Earliest Dynasties' I, 28, pl.XXXVII, 55; W. M. F. Petrie, 'Royal Tombs of the Earliest Dynasties' II, pl. XLII, 72.
